instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: the efi and OS diagnostics both passed.  the only strange thing that i notice is that <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL>  is 0.9v and it charges really slow.  <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> has been replaced several times and <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> was replaced

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message:
Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Check <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/51/52 and traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: 2.7 ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> is 8.3v  when there is no battery and .9v with a battery. the fan runs normal without battery attached and it runs full speed with a battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> is good.
Check <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE_R</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_OVP_A</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE_R</SIGNAL> is 8.3v with the battery disconnected and 0.9v with the battery connected
<SIGNAL>CHGR_OVP_A</SIGNAL> is 0v  with or without the battery
today i replaced the smc  and the fan ramps up and is still loud with the battery attached
it still passes the diagnostics

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message:
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage w/ and w/o battery connected?

Test the machine disconnecting BIL (J6995), with battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: 8.28v with the battery. 8.39 without the battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message:
"Test the machine disconnecting BIL (J6995), with battery."
Still not working properly?

BTW, did you test with known good battery?

threads.message: i'll order a replacement

threads.message: Did you test disconnecting J6995???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: Get a known good battery for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: today i installed a new battery and the fan still ramps to the max speed but if the battery isn't connected then they run normal speed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message:
New chinese battery?
Is it charging at least?
Machine turns on with battery, without charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: it all works as should but the fan is running full speed with the battery attached.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: Run HWMonitor and post a picture with its report...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: hmmm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message:
Check current and voltage sensors, at pages 50/51; especially DCIN and BMON current.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/51/52 and their traces are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans run at full speed when the battery is attached
threads.message: after letting the computer run for a while the fans slow down
